intro: Caucalis leptophylla var. bifrons, commonly known as the narrow-leaf caucalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. Its flowers are small and white or greenish, clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
